title: The Sunne in Splendour
description: Across the battlefields of England, the sunne in splendour rose in glorious triumph.In 1461, in one of the bloodiest battles of the War of the Roses, the House of York lay claim to the crown of England. The fate of the nation would be determined by the Plantagenets and by their wives mistresses, and royal advisers.Edward IV - king at the age of nineteen, he was blessed with charm, courage and unholy luck, but he was also the keeper of a dark secret that would bring chaos to the royal courts after his death,Elizabeth Woodville - Edward's cool, calculating wife, she was a beautiful woman ruled by vindictiveness and ambition.Anne Neville - daughter of a powerful nobleman, she was used as a political [awn by her father, a supporter of the House of Lancaster, yet overcame all odds to marry her childhood sweetheart, Richard.Richard III - Edward's younger brother, he was intense, emotional, pledged to Edward by blood and by the fire of battle, and made fatally vulnerable by his undying loyalty and conscience. Betrayed by those closet to him and by history, Richard III is now restored to his proper place, in Sharon Kay Penman's compelling portrait of a man passionate in love and war, doomed by forces beyond his control.
author: Sharon Kay Penman
